bibl.title: Letter from Nannie Mason Barret to Laura Armistead Carter, [19--]

div1.p: Barret offers Laura Carter condolences on the death of Henry Carter and reminisces about him.

div1.head: Letter from Nannie Mason Barret to Laura Armistead Carter, [19--]
div1.p:
How can I
try to tell you all I
feel for you? You know
without my telling you
that we share your
sorrow for indeed your
father held a very big
place in our hearts.

I hope you had never
told him about Nancy.
I like to think of
their being together.
I know Claudia wrote of
their losing “Gracey” after
a show they had but
when I opened a drawer
the other day there
was Laura Carter in a
bright red silk dress
that Nancy had made.

I have given away nearly
everything but some like
Laura, I hate to part with
& am saving them for
the baby. Claudia never
play's dolls now that
she is alone, so we've
had to take up music lessons &
sewing & things like that.

I shall never forget your
father's pride in telling some
friends at our house about his
daughter. He said boys were fine
all right but they didn't rank
with girls.

I feel it a great privilege to
have known a wonderful man
like your father & we will
never forget his visits. What
charmed me most was, that with
all his greatness (for he was a
great man) he was so entirely
unaffected & was more interested
in the dolls at our house and
after one visit knew the names
better than I did.

It must be terribly hard for you
my dear, but what a glorious
memory you have to live with.

Harvy joins me in love &
deepest sympathy.
